instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00840: What is 820-00840? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMC_LID_LEFT: What is SMC_LID_LEFT? SMC_LID_LEFT is a signal that tells the system if the lid is closed from the left LID sensor. If it is low, the system thinks the lid is closed â€“ if it is 3.3v, the system thinks the machine is open. SMC_LID_LEFT needs to be high for the machine to stay awake and have a backlight. .
definitions.SMC_LID: What is SMC_LID? SMC_LID tells the machine the system is open when it is 3.3v to 3.4v, and closed when it is low such as 0v-0.6v. When this signal is low, the machine may go to sleep or have no backlight. .
definitions.HALL_SENSOR_LEFT: What is HALL_SENSOR_LEFT? HALL_SENSOR_LEFT is a signal from the hall sensor on the left side of the machine that indicates that the lid has been closed. This is necessary for setting SMC_LID properly so the machine knows whether it is closed or open. When this is low, the machine will think it is closed which may cause it to go to sleep or have no backlight on the screen.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
Hi, 


got this board with liquid damage. After all repairs were done and it booted all was ok except that fan start to spin for 2-3 seconds with very high revolutions and than stop. Do it 4-5 times and than fan stops. Every time fan start to spin it spin max. revolucion than stop spin, stop, spin stop,. 


I already checked all <RESISTOR>R4800</RESISTOR> <TRANSISTOR>Q4800</TRANSISTOR> zone and it all is ok. 


Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
I bet you still have something corroded.
Run HWMonitor and look at temps too.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
right, it was some corrosion under some components. Just putted it in ultrasonic for 1 more hour and now fan is ok, but trackpad sometimes stack. Checked trackpad and seems to be ok.


P.S. tried new trackpad and new flex and same. Onboard connector is ok and seems that Volts arriving also are ok. As the issue is "sometimes happenning" i cant find what exactly make trackpad fail. THe only thing i noticed is that when i close the macbook and it sleeps, after wake up about 20-30 second trackpad stuck and work, after that 30 seconds it's all ok.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
Check <SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL>/RIGHT and <SIGNAL>LID_OPEN</SIGNAL> signals.
Possible corrosion around <CHIP>U5255</CHIP>...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message: <SIGNAL>SMC_LID</SIGNAL> left 0V right 3.4V. LID OPEN 3.4 too. LID LEFT must be 3.4 too?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
Also installed HWmonitor and Airport proximity is 128C and Mainboard Proximity 128C, too Stable, all other values are movin up down, except theese two.

P.S. it's not only trackpad whole system freezes for few miliseconds than start working normal. Will try reinstalling Mojave.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
<SIGNAL>SMC_LID_LEFT</SIGNAL> should be high too.
Check <SIGNAL>HALL_SENSOR_LEFT</SIGNAL> at J5250.
Be sure <RESISTOR>R5253</RESISTOR> is good.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00840</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-a fans goes crazy after water damage
threads.message:
All ok now. It repair itself:S. 


Will check next hours and if nothing will mark it as solved.
